1: <sup>1</sup> Bless the LORD, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.
2: <sup>2</sup> Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:
3: <sup>3</sup> Who forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thy diseases;
4: <sup>4</sup> Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;
5: <sup>5</sup> Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things; so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
6: <sup>6</sup> The LORD executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.
7: <sup>7</sup> He made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the children of Israel.
8: <sup>8</sup> The LORD is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.
9: <sup>9</sup> He will not always chide: neither will he keep his anger for ever.
10: <sup>10</sup> He hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
11: <sup>11</sup> For as the heaven is high above the earth, so great is his mercy toward them that fear him.
12: <sup>12</sup> As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
13: <sup>13</sup> Like as a father pitieth his children, so the LORD pitieth them that fear him.
14: <sup>14</sup> For he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.
15: <sup>15</sup> As for man, his days are as grass: as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.
16: <sup>16</sup> For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall know it no more.
17: <sup>17</sup> But the mercy of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, and his righteousness unto children’s children;
18: <sup>18</sup> To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.
19: <sup>19</sup> The LORD hath prepared his throne in the heavens; and his kingdom ruleth over all.
20: <sup>20</sup> Bless the LORD, ye his angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandments, hearkening unto the voice of his word.
21: <sup>21</sup> Bless ye the LORD, all ye his hosts; ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.
22: <sup>22</sup> Bless the LORD, all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the LORD, O my soul.
